tidbits.title: Cultural Traditions
tidbits.description: Eswatini preserves rich cultural traditions, including the reed dance ceremony (Umhlanga) and the vibrant artistry of traditional handicrafts like the exquisite Sisal baskets.

tidbits.title: Scenic Landscapes
tidbits.description: The country features diverse landscapes, from the beautiful Ezulwini Valley to the stunning views at Malolotja Nature Reserve, attracting nature lovers and hikers.

tidbits.title: Monarchy and Heritage
tidbits.description: Eswatini, ruled by a monarchy, takes pride in its cultural heritage, seen in the preservation of royal traditions and ceremonies that form an integral part of society.
